results.title: I have Turkish blood in my body, how can I put it off? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Neil Munro
results.brief_description: An interview with two Turkish girls living in Australia which highlights family life in Turkish culture in comparison to Anglo Australian family life. Further it demonstrates clearly the substantial differences between sub-groups in the Turkish community.
results.title_for_label: I have Turkish blood in my body, how can I put it off? (TEFC)

results.title: I have a problem with the word 'integration'
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Lyn Bugden
results.brief_description: This program aquaints the viewers with the range of disabilities suffered by physically handicaped people. Emphasizes the right of all disabled children to maximize their quality of life and challenges teaches to accept the disabled into a normal classroom.

results.title: I hate your guts = The Intruder = The Informer
results.brief_description: After thirty commercial successes, Roger Corman here tackled the contemporary theme of racism and delivered an exemplary piece of tough-minded, hard-hitting low-budget filmmaking. William Shatner, exuding a sleazy but effective charm, plays a power-hungry demagogue who arrives in a small Southern town reluctantly facing up to desegregation. His impassioned speeches stir up the white community, revive the Ku Klux Klan and lead to attacks on black families and a near-lynching. Adapted from the novel by Charles Beaumont.
results.title_for_label: I hate your guts = The Intruder = The Informer

results.title: I dream of peace and rest: Norman Lindsay
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Dale McCrea
results.brief_description: The opening of Norman Lindsay’s house by the National Trust. The house exhibits work by Norman Lindsay, including sculpture in the gardens. Lindsay’s thoughts and reflections on his life and work are heard, and many of his works of art are shown. Narrated by Margaret Throsby and Don Reid.

results.title: I Don't kiss = J'embrasse pas
results.creator_credit: Bac Films (France), Cine Cinq, Gruppo Bruno, President Films, Salome, Maurice Bernart, Jacques-Eric Strauss, Jean Labadie and Andre Techine
results.brief_description: Manuel Blanc is Pierre, a young provincial adolescent who leaves his village to settle in Paris and become an actor. However, the big city proves difficult and expensive and when Pierre loses his job as a hospital orderly he soon finds himself working as a street prostitute. As his dreams disappear and his soul becomes hardened, it is only through his love for the enigmatic Ingrid (Emmanuelle Beart), who also works the streets, that Pierre can hold on to any aspirations for beauty and love. But Ingrid belongs to her pimp and Pierre’s desire soon leads to an inevitable tragic conclusion. Utilising the conventions of melodrama - including the cliched story of the “whore with the heart of gold” - Techine builds a compelling and gritty story of underclass life on the streets. Shifting from almost documentary style examination of the lives of the hustlers, junkies and criminals in the Paris underworld, to highly expressionistic colours and mise-en-scene for the fragile love affair between Pierre and Ingrid, “I Don’t Kiss” becomes a rhapsodic and moving account of the damages inflicted by both poverty and fate. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: I Cover the Waterfront
results.brief_description: A reporter uses a girl’s friendship to expose her father’s smuggling activities. “I Cover the Waterfront” is a tough and daring melodrama about organised crime and the brave men who try to expose it. Stars Claudette Colbert. Rated: G

results.title: I confess
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: A compelling thriller based on the privacy of the Catholic confessional. A young priest, played by Montgomery Clift, hears the confession of a murderer. Later, the priest himself is accused of the murder, owing to his friendship with a woman who was being blackmailed by the victim. Anne Baxter plays the woman, Karl Malden the police inspector and Brian Aherne the Police Prosecutor. Adapted from the play by Paul Anthelme.

results.title: I Claudius. Parts III and IV
results.brief_description: Claudius continues the history of his diabolical family. Plunged further into madness, Caligula imagines himself to be the most divine god of Rome. The power he wields causes him to act with cruelty and tyranny. Ultimately he is murdered by those no longer willing to suffer injustice. Claudius, the “old fool”, is reluctantly elected Emperor as prophesised. In Part IV, Claudius married to the cunning, unfaithful Messalina, rules wisely but longs for the Republic. These programs contain scenes of violence and nudity.
